(40) 462.November 25, 1940. \TO BE KEPT UNDER LOCK AMD KEY,It is requested that special care may be taken toensure the secrecy of this document.WAR CABINET.INFORMATION ABOUT THE WAR RECEIVED FROM THE POLISHAMBASSADOR AT THE VATICAN.Memorandum by the Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs.I CIRCULATE herewith, for the information of my colleagues, a copy ofa letter which I have received from the Polish Foreign Minister.H.Foreign Of/ice, November 25, 1940.70 Queen's Gate, S.W. 7,Dear Lord Halifax, November 22, 1940.IN the past t have from time to time communicated to you directlyinformation from Polish Representatives abroad which I considered might beof special interest to you.The following information from our Ambassador at the Vatican, dated the18th November, appears to me to come under this category : (1) The Ambassador notes that Vatican circles are increasingly inclined to admit the ultimate defeat of the Axis Powers. They foresee a longwar and fear a general spread of communism as a result. They donot consider the present moment opportune for any peace initiative.(2) Lack of harmony between the Axis partners is evidenced both by theprevention by Mussolini of the German attempt at a rapprochementwith France at the cost, of Italy, as also by the lack of co-ordination in connexion with the Italian campaign against Greece.(3) Molotov's visit to Berlin is regarded in Vatican circles as a gesture of support to Germany devoid of any real value, yet so in accord withthe Soviet policy of nourishing the war. This causes apprehensionand concern at the Vatican.(4) Graziani's Libyan offensive is held up through lack of water and difficulties relating to supplies. A special water system is in courseof building. Distilling of sea water has proved unsatisfactory.(5) The Greek campaign was insufficiently prepared militarily and isunpopular in Italy.11219 [21951] (6) The Dodecanese is suffering from serious lack of,petrol caused by the dislocation of sea transport.(7) R.A.F. air raids and bombings are having a deeply depressing effect upon the Italian population, which expresses itself in anti-governmental reactions.(8) Fascist circles threaten to apply decisive reprisals.I am,Dear Lord Halifax,Yours sincerely,AUGUST ZALESKI.
